newsitem.title: USA: Marcam Corp to post a Q3 charge, cuts jobs.
newsitem.headline: Marcam Corp to post a Q3 charge, cuts jobs.

text.p: Marcam Corp said on Monday that it will take a restructuring charge of about $22.0 million in the fiscal quarter ending June 30, 1997.
Of the total charge $7.5 million relates to job cuts and an additional $12.0 million relates to writing off capitalized software development costs, the company said.
A company spokeswoman said job cuts took place last week, but a number of laid off employees was not immediately available.
Marcam said the remainder of the charge is currently anticipated costs associated with the distribution of its Marcam Solutions unit to shareholders are $2.5 million.

"These actions, combined with internal program cost cutting, are expected to put Marcam Solutions, Inc. in an excellent position to drive towards profitability," Michael Quinlan, president and chief executive officer, said in a statement.

"Management believes that achievement of profitability and positive cash flow from operations as soon as possible is essential and that a combination of cost reductions and increased revenues is necessary to achieve this result," Quinlan said.
